course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Environment and Business
course.description: A course designed to introduce students of all disciplines to the compatibility of business profitability and preservation of the environment.  Students learn: 1) what environmental sustainability means and how companies develop strategies for a sustainable future; 2) how an effective environmental strategy requires an integrated response among firms, government, and civil society, and the various regulatory, collaboration and other means used to achieve integration; and 3) how the various activities within a firm work together and within society to achieve the sustainability strategy.

reviews.author: Amy_wkk
reviews.comment_content:
Practical and informative course. Suitable to those who are really interested in environmental fireld. If not, you will feel so suffered during lectures and preparing the project.

Personally think that ppt is not very organised and with too much pages. Have to spend a lot of time to read through and understand so as to do the assignments.

Topics:
-Course overview: design for sustainable development
-Next Industrial Revolution
-Human Nature of sustainable development: well-being and SDGs
-Environmental Issues
-Governance (Political-economic issues)
-Corporate options and strategy
-Environmental impact assessment and lifecycle analysis
-Design for environment
-Circular Economy
-Functions: corporate organization
-Accounting
-R&D and Production
-Marketing and Public Relations
-Purchasing and Reverse Logistics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring teaching. His speaking tone is really flat. He speaks very quickly and with a deep voice. I think he is not speaking very clearly. Not recommended if you do not master English very well.

The notes written on the board is very messy. You can't understand them unless you pay careful attention on what he is saying all the time.

*I always saw over 70% of the class not focusing on the lecture lol
reviews.comment_grading:
I find it hard to understand what the professor is saying and the ppt. Also, I didn't plan enough time for myself to do better for the personal final report. I didn't take the attendence of last lecture.

So... tragically I get C.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair.
No exams which is great. However, you have to spend some time on the boring ppt when doing assignments and project. Attendance is taken for some lectures and the guest lecture which is also boring.


There are also presentation, group report, personal final report and peer evaluation.

reviews.author: lyw_at
reviews.comment_content:
The course content covering many topics and facts, but lack a focus or goal in my opinion. The professor uses powerpoints with maybe 60 pages with actual content in each pages, while actually most of them you don't have to really have to know (especially with no mid term and final). It is like watching a documentary programme on tv: you hear a bunch of (probably interesting) information, and then retain very little of it.

Personally I am slightly disappointed. The course isn't very organised. Content is presented in a way that I can't learn much other than maybe broadening perspectives a bit. For some parts there are terminologies or logic that are quite confusing. A lot of facts are given, but it feels that not much guidance on analyzing and perspective. (For reference I am an engineering student so maybe I just don't get social science.)

If you want to know more about some companies' policies to be more environmentally friendly or trends related to protecting the environment, it can be quite interesting. To be fair I enrolled because I am interested in environmentally friendly stuff and I kind of is satisfied. Simply that, I am not sure what I actually learned.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is quite decent. Not the most intriguing lecturer, but absolutely not 'read off slides in monotonous tone' bad. Actually his voice is quite comfortable to listen to and his accent is quite clear. A good balance between non intrusive for people not paying attention while easy to follow for people who do want to listen. He will explain slides in details, give examples and key terms as well as being willing to answer questions in details.
reviews.comment_grading:
I still is not quite sure what is counted towards the final grade. Though apparently the project (1 presentation and 2 reports) has the largest weighting.

The problem lies in the grading presentation: peer grading is used. The actual calculation method isn't disclosed but I will say that adding up everyone's grades for your group and then getting a mean won't be far off. If you have confidence in your presentation skills and can squeeze a lot of content in a powerpoint, the grading method might be in your favor.

B and B- for the two reports, one sd below mean for presentation. Got C for overall.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light.

No mid term nor final.

Most workload comes from a group project that includes a 5 to 10 minute presentation, a report that turn the presentation into words, and an individual report based on what is done and simply adding some content according to a guideline. Both reports require 1000 words or less.

Also have two or three assignments, each can be done in an hour or two or even less.

reviews.author: Code Forgetter
reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.comment_content: I originally thought the course is more about design since it's one of the listed courses in minor design programme. However, it turns out to stress on the environment more. The ppt and content taught in class are not very clear and the assignments are sometimes hard to understand the logic. Maybe some concepts are quite recent so if you google them, you may not find too many supplemental materials. If you have learned some courses about the environment, you can take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not easy to follow the logic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really not good.
The marking scheme is not transparent enough. Many assignments are not counted to the score and it's quite confusing whether doing them is good or not. The score largely depends on the group project and personal report. So if you choose a good topic, then you are very likely to do well. Our team has asked the lecturer about our topic and he said ok, but then after our presentation, he said our topic is off the point. So our group project is B-.
Not sure how many students got A range. I only got B and I regret taking the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Medium.
Some in-class assignments and writing assignments.
One project: report, ppt, presentation and personal report.
No midterm no final.

reviews.author: Fishie
reviews.comment_content: Covered a very broad range of topics about Design for Environment (DfE) and sustainable strategies, but since there are no midterm exams at all, you don't need to memorise anything- just look back at the powerpoint for the homework, project, and final report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Decent teaching, not very interesting and fun, but not too boring as well. Good to those who want to learn and those who just want to satisfy common core. A very lenient professor that does not care about students who obviously are not paying attention (which is like 90% of the class lol).
reviews.comment_grading: Though the grade for the final individual report is not released yet, in general, the grading for past assignments are very good as long you paid the effort (like refer back to the lecture notes to answer questions).
reviews.comment_workload: Very little. No midterm and final, just some take-home assessments and DfE group project (presentation, group report, and individual report).

reviews.author: Phyllis Chan
reviews.comment_content: Pretty interesting content, a lot concerning environmental issues. Especially beneficial for students who have taken Geography in high school as some of the content overlaps. Also mentions a lot on designs in different stages of product productions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Slightly boring, mostly reading from powerpoint but also includes some documentaries and videos to make the lessons more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: Gradings are reasonable as long as you finish all the assignments and complete the last project and presentation properly.
reviews.comment_workload: No midterms or examinations so I would say the workload is pretty light. Includes some occasional quizzes, essays and assignments but are manageable. A group project including presentation included at the end with a final report but are all reasonable and manageable if you listen in class/ have common sense (lol).

reviews.author: Bubblebot
reviews.title: Great course contents with biases in grading
reviews.comment_content: Fairly interesting content with broad knowledge on sustainable strategy. If you are interested in environment or eco friendly start ups, I totally recomment you to take it. It is quite interesting to know all the design processes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures can be quite boring and no recordings will be provided. The professor is very kind and passionate. He will answer your question in details. Although the concepts are quite heavy on amount, they are explained well.
reviews.comment_grading: Huge biases in grading especially by the TA. Make sure to check your grade and the assignments with your friend because a same quality assignment can be graded one full grade lower. Do not complain to the TA because he will mark you down from that point. All assessments are graded by TA and the final report is graded by the professor. There is no transparency in terms of how they are graded (no rubrics for assessments which makes it extremely difficult to guess what TA wants), although the final grades are transparent. Fairly loose grading so I will give it a C.
reviews.comment_workload: Vert light workload! As long as you attend those lectures with attendance and do the assessments on time, you are safe. Most lectures do not take attendance (from what i rmb only 3 random times)

reviews.author: Kiks
reviews.comment_content:
contain somewhat interesting content about how a business can become more green.

The final project is about re-designing a product that is already out in the society.
reviews.comment_teaching: mostly power points, there are some videos to watch in class and activities for homework. There was also a guest speaker who came by to talk about his business and how he influences other big companies to change their business concepts to be more green and environmental friendly.
reviews.comment_grading: decent grading as long as you put in some effort into the course and complete all the assignments.

reviews.author: waicool20
reviews.comment_content: You get to learn about product life cycles and their impact on the environment.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor does a good job bin conveying ideas and presents it with different mediums. The class is very small ( and may get smaller mid semester) but the people who are there make the class feel OK.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fairly loose, it's best to participate proactively and contribute to the class, grading is fine as long as you do a decent job with handing in homework on time which is already fairly little.
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively very easy going class. No exams and only a final project required for final grading makes this course a great pick for those who want to have it easy but also pick up some knowledge on product design and the environment.

reviews.author: nyw
reviews.title: Good grading but think about the workload as well
reviews.comment_content: The course is about how to do business in a eco friendly way. Including how firms response to the environment by taking different regulations or amendments in their products. Also, the course include strategies and skills in how to pioneer different products to make them more eco-friendly. Eg. coffee capsule
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is passionate in teaching and is very kind to every students questions. As it is a relatively small class, atmosphere of learning environment it very good.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of the course is very transparent. An excel file will be uploaded with everyone name grouping score and individual score. So you can actually have a very good idea of your ranking among your class.
reviews.comment_workload: There are total of 6 assignments required to be handed in throughout the semester. Weighting of assignments are different and the assignment usually relates to one and other. (linkage of different stages of a project)
